column4: Hi. I'm having network problems. I rebooted and everything stopped working, it doesn't get ethernet. I've tried my cable in a Windows machine, works fine. I tried a live CD which used to work, but it doesn't anymore.
I'm looking for some tips, what should I do next? If the MAC address got scrambled, would that break ethernet access?
what is the output of ifconfig -a?
one moment... it's tehre but says "carrier:0"
you've rather lost me. ifconfig -a should list all devices and their current status
you say it works in windows?
the status of eth0 has no ip4 address, I looked in the filesystem place and read some stuff online, carrier should be = 1 if it has a cable
I have an ethernet port of my laptop that I have to set up with ethtool No link until I do so
which is why I was asking about the windows installation that you mentioned apparently worked
I mean the hardware doesn't physically have link lights at either end, too damn cheap
I got you. So linux sees the port because it is listed in ifconfig -a
and when you unplug the cable from the linux box and plug it in another machine, that one gets link?
yes, works on this laptop here in Windows, so it's not the cable
Ubuntu in their wisdom took ethtool out of the standard installation
does the machine have wireless access to the net?
Ubuntu doesn't recognise my wifi card :(
you can download ethtool from the repos on the windows machine and stick it on a usbstick
